question: Early diastolic notching of uterine aery disappears by which week of gestation?
exp: Diastolic Notching in uterine aery Doppler usually disappears beyond 22 weeks of gestation. Persistence of uterine notch beyond 22 weeks is indicator of preeclampsia.

question: Which mode of ultrasound help is Orbital biometry?
exp: A Mode Ultrasound is Amplitude Mode used for measuring Axial length of Eyeball and Orbital Biometry. A scan in Opthalmology is the A Mode Ultrasound. B mode is used in routine ultrasonography. M mode is used in chest and obstetric USG. D mode is used for vessels.

question: Optimal Doppler angle should be
exp: Ideal Doppler Angle for color doppler is 0 degrees ,Most blood vessels course parallel to the skin and zero Doppler angle is seldom obtainable. In addition, no Doppler shift is obtained at 90 degrees since the cosine of 90 degrees is 0. Thus, the optimal Doppler angle lies between 45 and 60 degrees.

question: All are USG findings in acute appendicitis except:-
exp: Acute appendicitis: IOC in children - USG IOC in adults - CECT (more sensitive) On USG Acute appendicitis appears as blind ending, tubular, non-compressible, aperistaltic structure with luminal diameter > or equal to 7mm. Has intact Gut signature - presence of hyperechoic mucosa & hypoechoic muscle wall of gut Show Appendicolith/Fecalith with posterior acoustic shadowing Figure: USG of acute appendicitis. On CECT Appendicular diameter > 6mm Lumen of caecum can be seen pointing towards obstructed opening of appendix called Arrow head sign. Thickened inflamed soft tissue at base of appendix - Cecal bar sign. Figure: Cecal bar sign Figure: Arrow head sign

question: POCUS is related to which imaging modality?
exp: POCUS is ultrasound that's done at the bedside - it's taking the machine and clinician to the patient in the context of clinical care. It is being increasingly used for COVID-19 patients to do ultrasound of CHEST. Typical features of COVID-19 on USG chest are B-lines and sub-pleural consolidation.

question: All are true about antenatal umbilical aery Doppler except?
exp: S/D Ratio of umbilical aery Doppler is increased in smokers. Decreased, absent or reversal of diastolic flow on umbilical aery Doppler suggests fetal IUGR and impending Fetal death. Fetal MCA S/D ratio is normally more than S/D ratio of umbilical aery. Fetal MCA S/D ratio is less than S/D ratio of umbilical aery Doppler in IUGR.
opa: Decreased diastolic flow of umbilical aery is suggestive of IUGR
opb: S/D Ratio of umbilical aery is less than S/D ratio of Fetal MCA
opc: S/D Ratio is decreased in smoking females
opd: Reversal of diastolic flow in umbilical aery Doppler suggests impending Fetal demise

question: Investigation of choice to visualize gallbladder pathologies:
exp: Ultrasound is the Investigation of Choice for most Gall Bladder pathologies like Acute Cholecystitis, Gb polyp, Gb calculus.

question: Preferred Investigation for diagnosing Acute Appendicitis in children?
exp: *Graded compression Ultrasonography is the preferred initial imaging modality in the evaluation of Acute Appendicitis in children.

question: Nuchal Skin Fold thickness Scan is done between:
exp: Nuchal translucency testing is distinctly different from and should not be confused with nuchal thickness testing. At the end of the second trimester (26 weeks), the nuchal translucency can no longer be seen and instead the nuchal fold thickness is measured between 16 and 24 weeks gestation. *Nuchal Skin fold thickness is measured in the second trimester usually between 18-22 weeks of gestation *The measurements are taken from the outer aspect of occiput to the outer aspect of skin fold *Values >6mm is considered abnormal and is a soft marker of Aneuploidy usually Downs Syndrome. *Nuchal translucency scan is done between 11-14 weeks of gestation behind the neck and is also a soft marker for Aneuploidy especially Down syndrome.

question: "Lemon sign" & "Banana sign" on Antenatal USG is seen in:
exp: Chiari malformations: Chiari malformation I: most common peg-like cerebellar tonsils displaced into the upper cervical canal through the foramen magnum Chairi malformation 1.5: described in the literature as both a condition in its own right as well as a variant of Chiari I malformation caudal descent of cerebellar tonsils and brain stem Chiari malformation 2: displacement of the medulla, fouh ventricle and cerebellar vermis through the foramen magnum usually associated with a lumbosacral spinal myelomeningocele. Chiari malformation 3: features similar to Chiari II, but with an occipital and/or high cervical encephalocele. Chiari malformation 4: severe cerebellar hypoplasia without displacement of the cerebellum through the foramen magnum probably a variation of cerebellar hypoplasia Chiari V malformation: absent cerebellum herniation of the occipital lobe through the foramen magnum Chiari 0 malformation: syrinx without cerebellar tonsillar, or brain stem descent infrequently used and confusing term to be avoided based on repos of syrinx improvement after posterior fossa decompression LEMON SIGN: anterior bowing of frontal bone BANANA SIGN: wrapping of cerebellum around brainstem 100 % of lumbar malignancies have Chiari malformation Dandy-Walker malformation: - agenesis of cerebellar vermis - large posterior fossa

question: Pulse echo principle is used by which modality?
exp: Pulse Echo Technique is used in Ultrasound, which sho-duration Ultrasound pulses are transmitted into the region to be studied, and Echo signals resulting from scattering and reflection are detected and displayed. The depth of a reflective structure is inferred from the delay between pulse transmission and echo reception. CT scan is based on Linear Attenuation of X Rays. MRI is based on Gyromagnetic propey of H+ ions.

question: Doppler effect results from change in-
exp: Doppler effect: change in frequency because of relative motion between moving source of sound and observer. Example: Sound waves hitting resting parenchyma Sound wave hitting moving RBC The difference gives color coding doppler effect. Color coding: based on direction of flow Flow TOWARDS probe: RED Flow AWAYfrom probe:BLUE Color does NOT depend on aery or vein Intensity of color depends on velocity of flow

question: Gas shadow in hea and great vessels appears in-
exp: IUD ROBE SIGN: Hyperechoic area inside hea and umbilical vein because presence of AIR SPALDING SIGN: Overlapping sutural bones on USG SPALDING SIGN ROBE SIGN

question: Earliest anomaly to be detected in ultrasound is:
exp: Earliest anomaly to be detected in ultrasound is Anencephaly (as early by 10th week) Anencephaly in Ultrasound: Acrania Loosely arranged brain parenchyma Frog Eye Appearance Figure: Frog eye sign and irregularly outlined brain patter protruding freely into amniotic fluid is seen, with absence of cranial vault.

question: T-sign is seen in
exp: The "T sign" and Twin-peak sign(or lambda (l)sign) and is used in ultrasound assessment of multifetal pregnancy. T sign refers to the thin intervening septa denoting a Monochorionic pregnancy. Twin peak sign/Lambda sign denotes Dichorionic Diamniotic Twin Gestation

question: Transcranial USG is done using which of the following probe
exp: *Sectoral/phase arrayed probe has a smaller footprint and is used in Chest USG,Echo,and Transcranial USG. TVS

question: Comment on the pic below?
exp: *The image shows an Anechoic (black )area between liver and Right Kidney in the Morrisons pouch suggestive of fluid indicating Hemoperitoneum and is considered as FAST positive Extended FAST is done to evaluate : 1.Hemoperitoneum 2.Pericardial effusion 3.Hemothorax 4.Pneumothorax

question: Best Investigation for diagnosing Minimal Right Pleural Effusion is
exp: *IOC for minimal Pleural Effusion is USG *Best X ray View for minimal Pleural Effusion is Ipsilateral Lateral Decubitus View.
opa: Right Lateral Decubitus Xiew X ray

question: Which of the following parameter gives accurate assessment of Gestational Age?
exp: Best parameters for estimation of fetal age FIRST TRIMESTER : CROWN RUMP LENGTH SECOND TRIMESTER : BIPARIETAL DIAMETER THIRD TRIMESTER : FEMUR LENGTH OVERALL : CROWN RUMP LENGTH BPD is measured in the trans thalamic view at the level of the thalami and cavum septum pellucidum. Cephalic index = BPD divided by occipito frontal diameter (OFD) CI = BPD/ OFD. If head shape is flattened (dolichocephaly) or rounded (brachycephaly), then HC is more reliable than BPD. USG in Pregnancy Best time to assess gestational age by USG is 9-12 weeks (by Crown rump length). Best indicator of fetal growth - Abdominal circumference. So the best USG parameter to detect IUGR is Abdominal circumference. The best USG parameter to detect Macrosomia is Abdominal circumference.

question: Diy grey shadowing on ultrasound is seen with:
exp: Posterior to air filled structures due to high percentage of reflection & small percentage of transmission, diy grey shadowing occurs. The Above image shows the Diy Grey Shadowing seen associated with presence of Air Dark Clean Shadow will be seen with Calculi as all utrasound waves are reflected with no transmission Dark Clean Shadow seen Associated with Large Vesical Calculus

question: Filarial Dance sign is seen on
exp: The Filarial dance sign refers to a twirling motion of microfilariae (e.g.W. bancrofti) noted in dilated lymphatic channels. It is identified as a characteristic sign and indicator of scrotal filariasis. The dilated channels are identified with absence of color flow on Color Doppler study (CDS) and the microfilariae as curvilinear echogenic undulating structures within it. Generally 5-6 microfilariae are seen per channel. GIF image: Filarial dance sign on USG

question: Evaluation of cardiac valve motion and fetal hea rate is done in which mode of Ultrasound?
exp: M-Mode Ultrasound is Motion mode and is used to evaluate Fetal Hea Rate and Cardiac Valve movement and echocardiography. Also used for detection of pneumothorax. A Mode Ultrasound is Amplitude Mode for measuring Axial length of Eyeball and orbital biometry (A scan in Opthalmology is the A Mode Ultrasound) B Mode Ultrasound is most commonly used mode. It is Brightness mode for routine Ultrasound. M Mode used in antenatal scan to calculate feral hea rate.

question: Imaging modality in PIRAD repoing scheme for prostate glands includes all except:
exp: Imaging modality employed in PI-RAD repoing scheme for prostate glands include Dynamic contrast enhancement Diffusion Weighted MRI T2W imaging PI - RADS classification Definition Total T2 + DWI + DCE score Total T2 + DWI + DCE + MRS score I Most probably benign 3-4 4-5 II Probably benign 5-6 6-8 III Indeterminate 7-9 9-12 IV Probably malignant 10-12 13-15 V Most probably malignant 13-15 17-20

question: This is a sonogram demonstrating CRL of an 8 weeks fetus. The arrow in the field points to which of the following?
exp: The above USG image shows Anaechoic (black) gestational sac with an embryo and yolk sac (arrow). The yolk sac is seen as a small well-defined anaechoic structure in side the Gestational sac.Presence of yolk sac or fetal pole within the gestation sac confirms pregnancy. Double decidua sign of the gestational sac is due to the interface between the decidua and the chorion, which appears as two distinct layers of the wall of the gestation sac.

question: Which of the following ultrasound marker is associated with greatest increased risk for Trisomy 21 in fetus:
exp: Increased nuchal skin fold confers the highest risk of aneuploidy and is the most powerful second trimester ultrasound marker, > 99% specificity for Down Syndrome. The probability of Down Syndrome is increased when multiple soft markers are present.

question: Most commonly used Piezoelectric crystal is
exp: Most Commonly used Piezoelectric Crystal in Ultrasound probe is Lead Zirconate Titanate. Quaz is a natural piezoelectric crystal. Piezoelectric Crystals conve electrical energy into sound waves and sound waves back into electric current. Ultrasound transducers act as both transmitter and receiver. Other impoant points for USG: - USG uses Harmonic imaging (better image quality) - USG uses Pulse echo principle - Frequency of USG waves in USG is 2-20 MHz NOTE Lead Lead is m/c agent used for radiation shielding. Lead aprons safeguard workers from effects of scattered radiations TLD badgesthat are worn under the aprons, to monitor radiation dose are made up of Lithium flouride/dysprosium. Walls and glass of CT scan room are made up of lead.

question: Which probe is used for Thyroid Ultrasound?
exp: Linear Probes have Higher frequency,better resolution and lesser penetration and are used for imaging superficial structures like thyroid scans,carotid dopplers,breast and scrotal usg Curvilinear probes have lesser frequency,poorer resolution and greater penetration and mainly used for imaging deeper structures Endocavitary probes are used for Transvaginal Ultrasound and TRUS

question: SIS stands for-
exp: SIS stands for- Saline infused sonography. USG used to evaluate tubal patency.

question: Duplex ultrasound is a combination of
exp: Duplex Scan Combination of B-mode imaging with Pulsed Doppler USG - gives both anatomical & physiological information of vascular system. Colour Duplex Scan Addition of colour frequency mapping - Colour Duplex imaging.
opa: A mode and pulse wave doppler
opb: B mode and pulse wave doppler

question: Posterior acoustic enhancement is seen with
exp: Posterior acoustic enhancement is seen with cystic lesions, gall bladder and urinary bladder. Posterior acoustic shadowing is seen with air, bone, calcification. Acoustic shadowing on an ultrasound image is characterized by a signal void behind structures that strongly absorb or reflect ultrasonic waves. This happens most frequently with solid structures, as sound conducts most rapidly in areas where molecules are closely packed such as in bone and stone.

question: Lambda sign or twin peak sign is seen in
exp: The Lambda or Twin peak sign at 10-14 weeks of gestation demonstrate the high reliability of ultrasound examination in determining chorionicity in twin pregnancies. The "T sign" is really the absence of a twin-peak sign(or lambda (l) sign) and is used in ultrasound assessment of multifetal pregnancy. It refers tothe lack of chorion extending between the layers of the intewin membrane, denoting a monochorionic diamniotic pregnancy.

question: Harmonic imaging is used in?
exp: Harmonic imaging is a technique in ultrasonography that provides images of better quality as compared with conventional ultrasound technique. Advantages over conventional ultrasound Decreased reverberation and side lobe aifacts. Increased axial and lateral resolution. Cyst clearing. Increased signal to noise ratio. Improved resolution in patients with large body habitus.

question: HIFU stands for
exp: HIFU stands for High-Intensity Focused Ultrasound. HIFU uses High Intensity Focused Ultrasound beam in the treatment of uterine fibroids and other lesions. it acts due to the thermal, mechanical and cavitational effects of the high-intensity Ultrasound beam in tissues.

question: ULTRASOUND PROBE FREQUENCY 1. Linear a. 20 2. Endoscopic b. 10-12 3. Curvilinear c. 7-10 4. Endocavitatory d. 3-5
exp: Different types of Probes / transducers Curvilinear probe Linear probe Endocavitary probe - 3-5 MHz (Low frequency) - Greater wavelength - Greater penetration - Poor resolution -Used for imaging deep structures e.g. kidney, ovary, fetal pas etc. - 10-12 MHz (high frequency) -Low wavelength - Poor penetration - Good resolution - Used for superficial structures e.g. thyroid, breast, scrotum etc. - 7- 10 MHz (Good frequency) - TVS (Transvaginalsonography) - TRUS (Transrectalultrasound) - TEE (Trans esophagealechocardiography) TVS (Trans vaginal sonography) IOC for Ectopic pregnancy Bladder must be empty before doing TVS - Endoscopic Ultrasound (EUS) Uses frequency of 20 MHZ Very good resolution Divides gut wall into 5 layers EUS is the IOC for local invasion or T staging of early esophageal cancer (IOC for Advanced esophageal Carcinoma - CECT)

question: TRIANGULAR CORD Sign is seen in?
exp: Biliary atresia: Has empty GB fossa / Ghost gall bladder "Triangular cord sign "is seen. Triangular cord sign represents the fibrous ductal remnant of the extrahepatic bile duct in biliary atresia. Carolis disease: It is a type V choledochal cyst - Intrahepatic biliary dilatation Shows "central dot sign" Hydatid of Liver Serous cystadenomas of pancreas: - demonstrates multicystic, lobulated mass in head of pancreas - characterised by centrally enhancing scar showing stellate calcification -'bunch of grapes appearance' is seen on axial T2 MRI image.

question: Investigation of choice to Determine Local Invasion in Esophageal Carcinoma(T staging) is?
exp: Endoscopic Ultrasound - Determines Local Invasion In Esophageal Carcinoma(T staging).

question: All are hyperechoic on USG except
exp: Bile is hypoechoic on USG. Air, bone, calcification and fat are hyperechoic on USG. Bile duct shown in the figure.

question: Most commonly used method of display of ultrasound is
exp: Applications- A-Mode- Commonly used for orbital biometry,Axial Length of eyeball. B-Mode (Brightness) : Most commonly used mode. M-mode (motion): Used for valvular morphology and motion,Echocardiography and Fetal Hear Rate monitoring.

question: Thyroid malignancies appear on USG as
exp: On sonography, thyroid tumors are solid,hypoechoic masses.

question: Fetal cardiac activity can be detected earliest by USG at which age of Intrauterine life-
exp: Fetal cardiac activity can be detected earliest by USG at 5-6-week age of intrauterine life.
